subject: Ethics
title: Placebo Ethics
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Placebo Ethics.

hook.text: A sugar pill cured a patient's headache. The doctor lied about what it was. Healing through deceptionâ€”ethical?

buildup.text: Placebos can produce real physiological effects. The brain's expectation of healing triggers actual relief.

discovery.text: In clinical trials, placebos help prove whether a drug truly works beyond the power of belief alone.

twist.text: But giving a sick patient a placebo instead of a proven treatment means withholding real medicine deliberately.

climax.text: The Helsinki Declaration says placebos are unethical when an effective treatment already exists.

punchline.text: Belief heals, but lies aren't medicine.

quiz.question: When are placebos considered unethical according to the Helsinki Declaration?
options: Placebos are always unethical in any context
When an effective treatment already exists for the condition being studied
